member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.EnclosingScopes
member.summary: This enumeration is returned as a result of a querying call to GetPropertyScope or GetCollectionScope methods of the SettingsManager class to learn the enclosing scopes of the provided property or collection. This is a flags enumeration meaning that it is possible that more than one enumeration flag could be set for the corresponding scopes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.EnclosingScopes.None
member.summary: None of the scopes contains the property or the collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.EnclosingScopes.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration scope contains the property or the collection.

member.summary: User Settings scope contains the property or the collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.EnclosingScopes.Remote
member.summary: Remote scope contains the property or the collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.ApplicationDataFolder

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsManager
member.summary: This is the gateway class to reach for the settings stored inside the Visual Studio. It provides two basic functionality. It allows to search for properties and collections inside the scopes. It hands the and classes for further manipulation of the collections and properties within the scopes.

member.summary: Invalid data type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsType.Int32
member.summary: Data type used to store 4 byte (32 bits) properties which are Boolean, Int32 and UInt32. Note that Boolean is stored 1 byte in the .NET environment but as a property inside the SettingsStore, it is kept as 4 byte value and any value other than 0 is converted to true and 0 is converted to false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsType.Int64
member.summary: Data type used to store 8 byte (64 bit) properties which are Int64 and UInt64.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsType.String
member.summary: Data type used to store the strings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsType.Binary
member.summary: Data type used to store byte streams (arrays).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsStore
member.summary:
Abstract class for reading/enumerating the selected scope's collections and properties. It is obtained from method.
In the methods of this class if the collection path is provided as the empty string ("") then it denotes the top level collection. If the property name is empty string then it denotes the default property of the collection.
Collections can contain properties and sub-collections. Sub-collections paths are described with the separators like directories in file system. Likewise, separator is '\' (back-slash) character. Example of a sub-collection path would be: "Root Collection\Internal Collection\Leaf Collection".

member.summary: Returns the value of the requested property whose data type is as boolean.
member.param: Path of the collection of the property.
Name of the property.
member.exception: Throws this exception if the property is of different type or if it does not exist.
member.returns: If the underling integer value for the property is non-zero, it returns true and false otherwise.

Value to be returned if the property does not exist.
member.exception: Throws this exception if the property is of different type.
member.returns: If the property does not exist, it returns the defaultValue passed in otherwise it returns true if the underling integer value is non-zero and false if it is zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Settings.SettingsStore.GetLastWriteTime(System.String)
member.summary: Provides the last write time of the properties and sub collections immediate to the given collection. The method does report any further changes internal to the sub collections (i.e. non-recursive). The last write time of a collection is updated if properties are created, deleted or their values modified or if a sub collection is created or deleted.

member.exception: If the collection does not exist, method throws this exception.
member.returns: Last update time to the collection in format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Telemetry.StubTelemetryActivity
member.summary:
Stub class equivalent to VSTelemetryActivity. Does not perform any actual operations but instead return stubs objects for some methods, while does nothing for the ones that do not require return values.
The purpose of this class is for instances where the Telemetry API should NOT exist, but still other components are dependant on it. In such case, we simply turn it into a No-Op class.

member.summary: IvsTelemetryPropertyBag doesn't support IDispatch.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Telemetry.StubTelemetryAssetService
member.summary:
Stub class equivalent to VSTelemetryAssetService. Does not perform any actual operations but instead return stubs objects for some methods, and do nothing for the ones that do not require return values.
The purpose of this class is for instances where the Telemetry API should NOT exist, but still other components are dependant on it. In such case, we simply turn it into a No-Op class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Telemetry.StubTelemetryContext
member.summary:
Stub class equivalent to VSTelemetryContext. Does not perform any actual operations but instead return stubs objects for some methods, while does nothing for the ones that do not require return values.
The purpose of this class is for instances where the Telemetry API should NOT exist, but still other components are dependant on it. In such case, we simply turn it into a No-Op class.
